project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Service Desk notifications completely stop being sent if a ticket contains a very high number of participants (for example, more than 60k).

The job responsible to send the notifications gets completely stuck, and re-starting Jira does not resolve the issue.
h3. Environment

Note that the bug was reproduced on Service Desk 4.7.1 and 4.14.0, but it is likely that this bug was already there in 3.x versions.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Install Jira 8.14.0 with Service Desk 4.14.0
 # Install the add-on [Data Generator for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210725/data-generator-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview]
 # Use this add-on to create 60k users in the Jira application
 # Run the following update queries in the Jira database, so that all the 60k Jira users created earlier share the same dummy email address:
{code:java}
UPDATE cwd_user set email_address = test@test.com;
UPDATE cwd_user set lower_email_address = test@test.com;
{code}
 # Re-start Jira, go to the page *⚙ > User Management > Users*, and confirm that 60k users are now sharing the same email address:
!Screenshot1.png|thumbnail!
 # Configure an SMTP server in *⚙ > System > Outgoing Mail Server*
 # Create a new Service Desk project and configure the *Customer Permissions* as below:
 ## Set *Who can raise requests?* to *Anyone can email the service project or raise a request in the portal*
 ## *Who can customers share requests with?* to *Any customer or organization, by searching in this project*
 # Create a new ticket in this project, and take note of the issue key
 # Configure a Service Desk Mail Handler via *Project Settings > Email Requests*
 # Send a new email to that Mail Handler by:
 ## Including the issue key in the subject of the email
 ## Adding in CC the dummy email address (test@test.com) used in the UPDATE SQL query
 # When the JSD Mail Handler processes the incoming email, it will map the 60k users to the email address added in CC, and it will automatically add the 60k users as participant of the ticket created earlier
!Screenshot2.png|thumbnail!
 # Now, create multiple Service Desk tickets, make some updates to them, add some comments, etc...

h3. Expected results

Service Desk customer notifications should be sent from these updates.
h3. Actual results

Service Desk customer notifications are no longer sent from any ticket from any Service Desk project in the whole Jira instance:
 - the Customer notification job is stuck processing a high number of rows in the table AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE
 - if you run the following query in the database several times in a row, you'll find that the number of customer notification that are waiting to be sent keeps increasing:
{code:java}
SELECT count (*) FROM "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "SENT_TIME" is null;
{code}
 - if you run the following query in the database, you'll find that the job responsible to send the notifications is stuck and shows as "Already running"
 -- Query:
{code:java}
select * from rundetails where job_id = 'sd.custom.notification.batch.send';
{code}
 -- Example of results:
{noformat}
    id    |              job_id               |         start_time         | run_duration | run_outcome |  info_message   
----------+-----------------------------------+----------------------------+--------------+-------------+-----------------
 101009 | sd.custom.notification.batch.send | "2021-05-04 09:25:49.011+02" |           10 | S           | 
 101354 | sd.custom.notification.batch.send | "2021-05-04 09:51:50.519+02" |           41 | A           | Already running
{noformat}
 - you can also verify that this job is stuck from the UI in *⚙ > System > Scheduler details*, as it shows as "Already running":
!Screenshot3.png|thumbnail!
 - if you generate thread dumps, you might see one of these 2 types of long running thread:
 -- either a PsmqAsyncExecutors-job thread:
{code:java}
"PsmqAsyncExecutors-job:thread-2" prio=5 tid=0x000000000000011d nid=0 runnable

h3. Workaround

The workaround consists in deleting all the customer notifications from the table "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" which are waiting to be sent by the customer _notification job_ that is stuck, and to also delete the problematic ticket which contains the high number of participants.

(!) Please be aware that if you apply this workaround, you will lose all the pending customer notifications as they will be deleted from the database.
(!) The queries below have been tested on a PostgreSQL Database. The syntax of these queries might be different, when using different types of Database.

The steps are listed below:
 # Look for the problematic ticket which includes the high number of participants. To identify the problematic issue:
 -- Run the following query to get the notification ID that the customer notification job is stuck at:
{code:java}
SELECT MIN ("ID") FROM "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "SENT_TIME" is null;
{code}
 -- Run the following query after replacing <ID> with the ID found in the previous query:
{code:java}
SELECT "ISSUE_ID" FROM "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "ID" = <ID>;
{code}
 -- Run the following query after replacing <ID> with the ID found in the previous query. This query will return the key of the problematic issue:
{code:java}
SELECT P.pkey||'-'||JI.issuenum
FROM jiraissue JI
JOIN project P ON JI.project = P.id
AND JI.id = <ID>;
{code}
 # After you identified the problematic issue, open it in Jira and delete it from the UI
 # Stop Jira
 # *Backup your Jira database*
 # Run the following DELETE query to remove all the pending customer notifications from the table AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE:
{code:java}
delete from "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "SENT_TIME" is null;
{code}
 # Start Jira
fields.summary: All the customer notifications are no longer sent if a ticket contains a high number of participants

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to paste any text to the {{Description}} field on the Portal, the field loses focus and does not paste the text.
Using the "Right-click > Paste" works.

The video below demonstrates the issue:
 [^Firefox.mp4]

(i) Issue reproducible only on Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any Customer Portal with the Mozilla Firefox browser.
# Create any type of Issue.
# Try to paste text in the description by using the keyboard shortcut (Cmd + V or Ctrl + V).

h3. Expected Results

The text is pasted normally.

h3. Actual Results

The field loses focus and does not paste the text.

h3. Workaround

Right-click the description field and choose the {{Paste}} option.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut pasting not working for Description field on Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Original FR: https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1669

h3. Description:

Insight Automation rules currently treats each objects returned by IQL and takes the Automation action on each object separately. Some used cases requires the results to be batched in together and take the automation action just *once*.



h3. Expected Result:
For example:
* Send one email with all the objects returned 
* Create one jira issue with all the objects returned 
etc
fields.summary: Add ability to Batch ALL results with Insight Automation Rule

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment Insight custom fields in Jira mobile app are not properly rendered.

As for now the Insight custom fields are available when connecting from a Mobile Browser, and switching to Desktop View.

Please improve the mobile app by adding the possibility of rendering also Insight custom fields.
fields.summary: Insight custom fields in Jira Mobile App

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While Approving an issue from REST API, Jira doesn't check if the Status if actually having an Approval associated to it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow similar to the below
 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 5.33.45 PM-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Move the ticket to the *Questions* status which doesn't require an Approval, In the UI also, there is no approve button shown.
 # But it is possible to Approve the issue from REST API

h3. Expected Results
 # As mentioned in the [documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.15.2/#servicedeskapi/request/%20\{issueIdOrKey}/approval-answerApproval], this should have thrown an error 400
 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 5.37.14 PM.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Actual Results

From REST API, it is possible to successfully Approve the request.
 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 5.38.15 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approving issues via REST API is possible even if the Status is not having an Approval in it

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When using the Insight Basic Search by for example filtering attributes, the values proposed are truncated, which make difficult to understand which one to select:


Improve the usability of the Insight basic Search by showing the entire value of each attribute:

 !Screenshot 2021-05-03 at 10.32.25.png|thumbnail! 

Looks like there is a limit of 31 digit for the attribute value to be shown.
fields.summary: Improve Insight Basic Search UI

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
[Insight post functions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/post-functions-1044784443.html] allows the use of [placeholders|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/advanced-placeholders-1044784599.html] to set values to target fields on issue transition.

The {{$\{updated\}}} placeholder gets the value from the Issue Updated field, which stores both the Date and Time when the issue was last updated.
With the current feature set, this placeholder only gets the Date portion of it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the {{$\{updated\}}} placeholder to get the DateTime from the Issue Update field.
Maybe it could be as flexible as [date smart values|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/working-with-dates-993924630.html] in automation.
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I would like to use full DateTime value from the ${updated} placeholder in an Insight post function

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Object not selectable due to limit to first 25 objects
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an objectType called Test for example with an object attribute called reference
 # Create over 25 objects in that objectType Reference, let these object have uniqenames.
 # Go back and edit the attributes reference in the Test objectType, see that you cannot select all the objects within those objects that are above 25, because you are only able so select 25 and not above 25 which makes some of the objects missing from the list.

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to select all of the objects and not have some objects missing due to the 25 number of limit objects.
h3. Actual Results

You can only access 25 of the objects. If the object you are looking for is not within these first 25, you cannot access or select that object.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
h3. Workaround

Split up all the objects in several objectTypes - This is not a good solution though
fields.summary: Object not selectable due to limit to first 25 objects

fields.description: When using basic search and the result is bigger than 10 objects it only tells me that more objects exists but I'm unable to see them.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to navigate all search results > 10 in Insight basic search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Using Placeholders in Automation Rules - the Placeholders access data field values. Insight is rightly applying controls so that the accessing (Rule Executing) user needs to be an object scheme user to see the value. 
However, if you don’t have access not only is there no value but there is no warning in the logs when set to DEBUG and in the UI itself when setting the rule.

It’d be even better if the UI presented this warning. It knows who the placeholder will be executed as.
fields.summary: Warning message / Log entry when Executing User of an Automation Rule does not have sufficient Permissions

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Replying over notification mails, causing attachments unreadable and this has been observed in the outlook as in the Gmail it's working fine without issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure both [outgoing mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-an-smtp-mail-server-to-send-notifications-947184044.html] & [incoming mail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/creating-issues-and-comments-from-email-938847641.html]
 # Generate a notification that contains attachments in the message body(those have been copied and pasted)
# reply with attachments in the message body by copying and pasting some images

h3. Expected Results

A comment should be added to the issue comment section with only the latest message & attachments pasted in the last email response.

h3. Actual Results

A comment is getting added to the issue comment section with all attachments even from the previous responses and also the last added attachment is getting added at the end of the comment and also it's becoming un-readable.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Replying over notification mails, causing attachments unreadable

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Incoming mail not removed original content with content-language non english

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Incoming Email request to create a JIRA service management ticket 
 # Send a test email with the English content to the Incoming mail box
 # Change the language setting on your mail client (outlook web/ GMAIL settings)
 # Reply to the test email sent earlier with new content


h3. Expected Results
* First email should be creating a Jira ticket.
* The Second email since is the reply to the first email, should be creating a comment on the Jira ticket, and content should only contain the new content. 

h3. Actual Results
* First email should be creating a Jira ticket.
* The Comment created on the Jira ticket, should only contain the new content rather than original email content.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incoming mail not removed original content with content-language non english

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Insight IQL {{Updated > now()}} return results whereby it should return *no results* as the use of '>' operator with {{now()}} function indicates future date and time.

h3. Environment
 * Jira Software 8.13.2
 * Jira Service Desk 4.13.2
 * Insight 8.6.12

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Note the Jira system timezone. Eg: (GMT+10:00) Sydney
 # Update Jira user timezone under 'Profile > Preferences'. Eg: (GMT+14:00) GMT+14
 # Update an object
 # Run the IQL {{Updated > now()}}

h3. Expected Results
No results returned as the IQL searches for future date and time

h3. Actual Results
IQL returns 1 result which is the newly updated object

h3. Workaround
No workaround available as of now
fields.summary: Insight IQL 'Updated' attribute returns inaccurate results when used with 'now()' function

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight is adding additional JS and CSS content to regular Jira pages that don't normally have any Insight content (/secure/RapidBoard.jspa, secure/Dashboard.jspa) even in projects that are not using Insight fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have Insight installed either with bundled JSM install or with the plugin
# Use any filter result screen or board filter screen in a project;
# Depending on the instance size, these pages may take additional seconds to load since Insight is installed;
# Capturing a HAR file from these pages you will notice a lot of additional JS and CSS from Insight, even though these filter results and boards are not using Insight at all:
# This can cause additional overhead, especially in large instances loading huge filters and boards:
!080ac0ca-74ed-4579-960a-7c93a0abc1a5.png|thumbnail!


h3. Expected Results
Insight should not add this much content to non-Insight pages, or it should be tweaked and reduced.

h3. Actual Results
It is adding a lot of CSS and JS content which causes overhead in very general Jira pages:
!080ac0ca-74ed-4579-960a-7c93a0abc1a5.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at this point.
fields.summary: Insight adds additional Java Script to regular Jira pages

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Whenever setting an IQL filter in an attribute with placeholder {ObjectType} such as:

Filter by IQL: object HAVING inboundReferences(Type = ${objectType})

the referenced objects will be selectable at object creation but not while editing them afterwards.

This is expected behaviour and it is due to how the form is built. 

In fact in the Object Creation form, the Object Type that we want to create is available. 

However, on the edit screen, the Object Type is missing. 

For the placeholder, it pulls directly from the value found on the field. Since the Object Type is not found in the Edit form, it does not work there.

Provide a way for this to work also in object edit.
fields.summary: Allow the IQL filter in attribute settings to work when editing objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attributes are not viewed in order when you have objects that use inheritence. If you for example have object House with attributes named from 1 - 6 like this room1, room2, room3, room4, room5, room6. It will have the correct order once you view them in the object edit screen but if you click on the object and view it in the object view, it will change the order and not be in the order that you created them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Look at the zip file attached to this issue, import it to your Insight instance, it is a small object schema.
 # Notice that there are two objectType parents with its child objects. One has inheritance - Object A(15) and one has not - Parent.
 # Watch the Gif picture and see how it is reproduced. 
 # In the object edit view for Parent objectType, the attributes are in order from 1 - 5. If you click on the object key to get to the object view, they are not in order

h3. Expected Results
They should be in the order you created them

h3. Actual Results
They are not in order

 !2021-04-22_11h18_18 (1).gif! 


h3. Workaround
Do not use inheritance to workaround this.
fields.summary: Attributes not in order in object view INSIGHT

fields.description:
Hello!
Can you please register a feature request for Insight to make possible to search for object by any of it's attribute? I will describe more:
Right now, when I create an Insight customfield, I can choose what attributes will be used on searching, when I will set value of this field. This is good.

I want same functionality insight object's attribute. For example, I have object type named Computer.
In this object type I added attribute Operating System with type Object, so I'm choosing objects from object Type Operating Systems.

When I editing/creating Computer object and setting Operating system field (attribute), search using only Label attribute of Operationg Systems objects to help me find object. I want to add another attributes of Operating Systems be searchible too. Like as in Insight Customfields.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer Portal users need to log in to Confluence while accessing KB articles from the customer notification email
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Project Settings > Knowledge base
 # Link a Confluence space to this JSM project with the below settings
 !image-2021-04-26-18-32-17-352.png|width=269,height=217!
 # Ensure that Confluence space is not having anonymous view access
 # Trigger a customer notification with a linked KB article
 # Log out from Confluence
 # Click on the KB link from the customer notification
 !image-2021-04-26-18-34-14-825.png|width=257,height=140!
 # Users are redirected to a confluence log in page
 !image-2021-04-26-18-35-21-247.png|width=380,height=106!

h3. Expected Results

As per the view settings in the JSM project, _'All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.'_ customers should be able to access the KB article without being redirected to the confluence login page
h3. Actual Results

Customers (Portal users) are redirected to the confluence log in page when trying to access linked KB articles from customer notification email
h3. Workaround

Access the KB article from the customer portal directly *OR* [Make the Space Public|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/make-a-space-public-829076202.html]
 # In Confluence, Go to the required space and choose *Space tools* > *Permissions* from the bottom of the sidebar
 # Choose *Edit Permissions*
 # Scroll down to the *Anonymous Access* section and select the only View permission
 [!_thumb_5915153.png|thumbnail!|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5915153/5915153_screenshot-1.png]
 # *Save All* to apply the changes
 # Ask the customers to access the link from an email

(i) This will make the KB article public, please review your organization's security constraints before proceeding with the change
fields.summary: Customer Portal users need to log in to Confluence while accessing KB articles from customer notification email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Originally reported in https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1556
Currently Insight logs are generally stored in Jira {{<SHARED-HOME>}} location which is not included by default in Jira Support Zips

h3. Suggested Solution

* Or include the insight logging directory configurable in Support Zip customization

h3. Workaround

Follow [Where are the Insight logs for Data Center installations|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/where-are-the-insight-logs-for-data-center-installations-1040617518.html]
fields.summary: Include Insight Logs in Support Zip for Jira Datacenter

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
At the moment it is not possible to restrict the file size and the number of backup of Insight related log files. Currently, Insight logs do rotate so that a new file is created every day, but this happen disregarding of reaching a certain size and old files are retained.

h3. Suggestions
Please implement a way to rotate log files as per Jira behaviour when reaching a certain size and removing the old ones by
* Allowing maximum log file size to be configurable
* Allowing number of backup log file to be configurable

h3. Notes
Similar feature requests in Mindville portal
* https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-681
* https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-952
fields.summary: implement log rotating based on file size for Insight logs

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Schema Manager - I would like to be able to send an HTTP Request as the Action of an Automation Rule, then parse the Response into Attributes, similar to the same Action in Insight For Jira Cloud

See: https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/Insight+Automation#InsightAutomation-HttpRequest
fields.summary: Insight  Automation - Action: HTTP Request, Parse the Response similar to Insight on Jira Cloud

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Schema Manager, I would like to be able to configure the order in which Actions are executed (if more than 1 action per IF/THEN condition)

For example:
Set an Attribute Value in a Groovy Script (e.g. Calculate a complex value)

Execute an HTTP Request with a placeholder for this Attribute

As both Actions will be executed in parallel - it may well be that the Attribute will not be calculated BEFORE the HTTP request is sent out, hence the HTTP request will be lacking the desired information...

As a workaround - the HTTP request may be sent from the Groovy Script, yet it will be nice to ORDER the Actions, or/and possibly, to have the option to add a delay before executeion.
fields.summary: Insight Automation - allow the Actions to be executed in order - one after the other

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: In Jira Service Management, whenever a new Service Desk project is created, it already includes a few default project queues. It would add value to Jira administrators if they were able to customize these default queues so that newly created projects already included their updated versions.
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to customize the Default Project Queues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
At the moment Insight Discovery pings ALL IPs in a scan setting range, and then scans the responsive IPs - so NIC is being scanned from the Network's side, and not from the HW (Host Side).

This mean that inactive NICs info on the target host will be not retrieved.

Please provide a way to allow Discovery tool also retrieve inactive Nic.
fields.summary: provide a way for Insight Discovery tool to retrieve inactive Network interfaces

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, when we set the following default scenario:
 * The goal of 8 hours
 * Calendar from 9 to 17

The SLA pauses at 17:00, and breaches at 9:00 am the next day, when it should breach at 17h.
h4. Current Behavior

The ticket SLA starts at 9:00h, and when it comes at 17:00h sharp, it will pause at 0m, causing the ticket to immediately breach at 9:00 am the next day, instead of 17:00h.
 !image-2021-04-21-19-43-46-971.png|width=326,height=61!
h4. Expected behavior

The breach to happen at 17:00 sharp
 !image-2021-04-21-19-44-19-942.png|width=562,height=92!
h4. Workaround

To have the breach happen at 17 sharp, you may use one of the following options:
 # Increase the working hours by one minute. Example: 9:00 - 17:01
 # Reduce the goal by one minute. Example: From 8h to 7:59h
fields.summary: SLA to breach at the time it was set, not one minute after

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Here is a use case:
As a customer, I want to be able to create a Ticket in the JSM Portal, and select an object from a list of objects which were not linked to a similar request before.

I would like to use the following IQL:
Filter Issue Scope:

object NOT HAVING connectedTickets("Customer Request Type" = ${customfield_10106})

While I can use this IQL in an IQL Postfunction, I cannot use it in the Filter Issue Scope
fields.summary: Insight CF - Allow the Filter Issue Scope to use JQL in connectedTickets(<JQL>)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have recently added a bugfix to the Graph View, not respecting the Reference Depth (JSDSERVER-7182) - which works as expected, however, it changed the earlier behaviour of the Graph View:
 When Reference Depth = 1, the object graph view should show any inbound / outbound references and objects for the selected objects - this works fine.

In older versions of Insight - when objects visible in the graph had references between them - these references will be visualized as well, with no additional action - even as these are "2 references deep" .

Current behavior in Insight 8.7.9:

!image-2021-04-21-10-42-52-650.png|thumbnail!

Desired behavior:

!image-2021-04-21-10-43-25-237.png|thumbnail!

Workaround:

Either double click any of the referenced objects to show their respective 1st level references, or, set Reference Deep to 2.

Both these options though - may show even more objects, which may not be required. (can be filtered out by unchecking their respective RefType - if applicable)

 These options, however, may add multiple Objects to the Graph view, making it impossible to view...
fields.summary: Insight Object Graph View - to show references between visible objects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Object schema zip import failed with Import file not found error if the Insight import directory is a symlink or in a symlink directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira Data center instance, set up symlink for the shared home directory and use it. Example: 
{code}
$ ln -s /Users/support/jiradc/sharedhome /Users/jira/directory/sharedhome
$ pwd
/Users/jira/directory/
$ ls -al
rwxr-xr-x   1 support  staff     37 Apr 21 11:25 sharedhome -> /Users/support/jiradc/sharedhome
{code}
 In the [cluster.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/set-up-a-jira-data-center-cluster-993929600.html#SetupaJiraDataCentercluster-3.ConfigureyourJirainstancetoworkinacluster] file, make sure the {{jira.shared.home}} is pointing to the symlink correctly.
 # Create an object schema and export it as a zip file as per [Object Schema Export|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/object-schema-export-33466944.html]. Make sure the zip file is exported to the export/insight folder in the symlink directory.
 # Copy the zip file from the <symlink>/export/insight folder into <symlink>/import/insight folder.
 # Import the zip file as per [Object Schema Import|https://documentation.mindville.com/insight/latest/object-schema-import-33466951.html].

h3. Expected Results
The object schema is imported successfully

h3. Actual Results
* The import failed with error "NotFoundInsightException: Import file not found" on the screen.
 !image-2021-04-21-12-03-33-501.png|thumbnail! 
* If you check the <Jira_installation>/temp directory, you will find empty folder with name like "insight_import<a string of numbers>" for every failed attempt of object schema zip import. 
* The below exception is thrown in the insight_objectschema_import.log file:
{code}
2021-04-21 11:48:40,787 [http-nio-1121-exec-3] | Initial error, when unzipping file: , Error: NotFoundInsightException: Import file not found
com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.NotFoundInsightException: NotFoundInsightException: Import file not found
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.schema.ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.validateFilePath(ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.java:928)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.schema.ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.unzipImportFile(ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.java:917)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.imports.schema.ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.shouldWarnBeforeImport(ObjectSchemaImportServiceImpl.java:865)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.channel.web.api.rest.services.ObjectSchemaImportResource.noWarnings(ObjectSchemaImportResource.java:120)
...
2021-04-21 11:48:40,821 [http-nio-1121-exec-1] | Resource: Import object schema to server, in data:com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.channel.web.api.rest.model.imports.schema.ImportObjectSchemaInEntry@53ebc5e6[fileName=testexport.zip,objectSchemaName=IXHG,objectSchemaKey=IXHG,objectSchemaDescription=<null>,password=<null>,includeObjects=true,importAttachments=true,importObjectAvatars=true]
{code}

h3. Workaround
Do not use symlink for the Insight import folder
fields.summary: Object schema zip import failed with Import file not found error if the Insight import directory is a symlink or in a symlink directory

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

SLA section doesn't have enough space to show Time with Kanji character when language profile is Japanese.
 Also, this issue happens when the language profile is Chinese.

!jsm-sla-compare-english_japanese.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1. Set language setting as Japanese in User profile.
 Step 2. Go to Jira Service Management project with issue view and check SLA section. Sometimes characters are hidden because there is no enough space in SLA section.
 - (Appendix) EN -> JA
 -- month: mo -> か月
 -- days: d -> 日間
 -- hour: h -> 時間
 -- minutes: m -> 分

h4. English(OK)

!jsm-sla-english-OK.png|thumbnail!

Note: I changed the language setting without reloading this screen, so some Japanese instructions are displayed on the screen(ex: button, instructions, etc. Please ignore them).

h4. Japanese(NG)

!jsm-sla-japanese-NG.png|thumbnail! 
 -> You can't check the SLA(You can't read "40"). Only "日間(days) 30分(minutes)" shows.
h4. Chinese(NG)

!jsm-sla-chinese-NG.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results
 - Always you can check all characters in SLA completely.

h3. Actual Results
 - Sometimes you can't check all characters in SLA.

h3. Workaround
 - Change your language setting to English in User profile.
fields.summary: SLA section doesn't have enough space to show Time with Kanji characters when language profile is Japanese.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Ability to utilize time conditions within SLA specific JQL queries that do not currently support them, such as *completed**()*, *paused()* and *running()*.
h3. Suggested Solution

Similar to the *elapsed()* and *remaining()* JQL queries, we would like the ability to filter *completed**()*, *paused()* and *running()* based on a time condition. For example:
{code:java}
completed("20m"){code}
This could be utilized with the available SLA rules to output issues with an SLA that was "completed" within 20 minutes.
fields.summary: Support of Time Conditions for SLA specific JQL queries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sorting search result with an Insight custom field + issue key do not sort issues with issue key in the specified order (ASC or DESC)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{panel:title=Populate the data}
 # Populate the data by creating a sample project from the ITSM template.
 # Create an object schema and create an object type called Location (example).
 # Create a few objects like Amsterdam, Boston, Cape Town.
 # Create an Insight custom field to allow objects from Location to be selected and add it to the right issue screen.
 # Search for all issues with {{reporter = agrant-sd-demo}} and bulk edit it to assign Boston as the Location. Assign Amsterdam and Cape Town randomly (just 3 to 4 issues)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Insight currently allows technically infinite (read that as "a lot") number of objects to be bulk deleted. Basically, whatever the number of objects returned in the IQL search falls within the scope of the delete operation.

Depending on the type of deletion (all objects in an object type, some objects based on IQL etc.) this operation includes very heavy sequential operations on the DB viz., Delete the attribute values, delete the attributes, delete the objects AND update all referenced objects to the deleting objects. Since there's no way of knowing all the references, currently insight does a scan of ALL OBJECTS and then updates the attributes of the existing objects referencing the deleting objects.

This way of handling bulk deletion causes:

* The UI progress "busy" animation stops even when the deletion is progressing in the background
* Indeterministic impression of results (sometimes 150 objects will be deleted all at once, sometimes it will still show 10 objects left since the background task is still ongoing and index is not yet updated)
* Database locking exception (viz., {{OptimisticLockException}} since user might think that the delete operation missed out on few objects and run a second pass)


h3. Suggested Solution
* May be a "Progress bar" or something similar to let the user know there's "work in progress"
* May be, put a configurable limit the number of objects to be deleted by the object count settings on the UI with a max value of 1000 max objects (default) which can be further adjusted based on scenario, capacity etc. 

h3. Workaround 
Detailed workaround is published in this KB: [How to bulk delete Insight objects efficiently|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-bulk-delete-insight-objects-efficiently-1077780749.html]
fields.summary: Improve Insight Bulk Delete operation

fields.description:
h3. Note

In this bug description, "custom field" will referred to as "CF".

h3. Issue Summary

Reproduced with Jira 8.5.3, 8.7.1 & 8.12.1; Insight 8.6.8, 8.7.7 & 8.7.9

An Insight Read Only CF cannot be edited by Users, and it populates based on its Filter Assign Scope, which may have dependency on other CFs.

When the Read Only CF is using another Insight CF in its IQL Filter - the CF will populate correctly, but when the parent is cleared of all values, the Read Only cf will not clear, and will keep its last value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a set of objects in Object Type A, and Object Type B
 # Object Type A is referencing Object Type B using the attribute TestAtt
 # configure an Insight Object CF "InsightCF" with simply Filter scope IQL: objectType="Object Type B"
 # Configure an Insight Read Only CF with:
 Filter scope IQL: objectType="Object Type A"
 Filter Assign Scope IQL: TestAtt=${InsightCF}
 # change values in "InsightCF" (in Edit or Issue Screen) and see that the Read Only CF follows accordingly (V)
 # Now that you have the Read Only CF populated, clear the value in "InsightCF"

h3. Expected Results

Since the parent CF is cleared, the Read Only CF will also clear and will have no value
h3. Actual Results

The Parent CF is cleared, but the Read Only CF still shows the last value it had
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 

Comments:

This also affects Insight Object CF with Filter Assign Scope Strict.

When the Insight Read Only CF is set on another type of CF, e.g. a Text CF (Assign Scope: Name LIKE ${TextCF} ) - when the TextCF is cleared - so does the Read Only CF

[https://jira.mindville.com/browse/ICS-1218ins]
fields.summary: Insight Read Only custom field is not Cleared when Parent Insight custom field is cleared

fields.description:
At the moment when an attribute of an insight object is modified via an automation rule no updated event is thrown and therefore no listener is triggered.

This is default behaviour and OBJECT_UPDATED event is set not to be dispatched in the automation rule code to avoid recursion (that the automation rule would trigger itself over and over again).

The code could probably be updated e.g. check the event category to see if the action should be executed or if it is the result of a previous executed automation action.

Please provide an option for the event to be thrown on the automation rule settings.
fields.summary: implement the choice for triggering OBJECT_UPDATED event on Insight automation rule

fields.description:
To specific customers to manage tickets on behalf of their organisations an incredibly useful feature would be to have a non-'plug-in' option for JSD customers to export to CSV, from the 'All Requests' and 'My Requests' areas within the JSD Customer Portal.

*Benefits:* 
 * Quick management/editing from a customer perspective (can amend priority, summary, etc. in place in Excel)
 * Quick management /editing from an Agent perspective (can upload customer/own edits on tickets in bulk) 
 * More easily allows a customer to perform their own support ticket analysis (e.g. open or close velocity per week, or counts on custom fields, etc.) - ** non-'plug-in' reporting features through JSD are already very limited

 

I know this has gained traction before, but this item is very much desired so it would be good to know the reasons for not implementing.
fields.summary: JSD Customer requires ability to export organization/raised items to Excel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The project's Customers list in earlier version like 3.1.4 includes Agent in the list for a public project but with a label {{AGENT}} next to the name and it helps to differentiate an Agent from a Customer. However, Agent (if he/she is part of the project's Service Desk Team) is not included in the project's Customers list in later versions like 3.3.0 and above.

h3. Suggestion
An option to include or exclude Agents in the project's Customers list on top of the label {{AGENT}} next to the name

h3. Why is it important
* In some cases, Agents raise tickets too and in the project's Customers list, we can easily tell how many open and close requests an Agent has.
* In some cases, Agents should not appear in the Customers list, the option to exclude Agents would help indefinitely.
fields.summary: Option to include or exclude Agents in a project's Customers list

h3. Issue Summary

This issue has been there for some time (insight 6.n).

Logged here as a bug, since other Insight Postfunctions will work for a JSM Customer - for example, Update an Object's Attribute with a predefined value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have a User with no Application Access to Jira, who can access the JSM Portal and create a Ticket
 # Install and configure an Insight Tempo Integration, sync the import
 # Make sure the Schema is enabled for Portal users (Roles Tab)
 # Create an Insight CF to be populated by the Tempo Account Objects - make it available in the Portal
 # Configure an Insight Tempo Postfunction to use the "Account Id" attribute from the Insight Account CF to set the Tempo Account CF. Make sure the PF is not the first one.
 # Log in as the Customer, and create a Ticket. Select an Insight Account Object in the Insight Account CF and create the Ticket

h3. Expected Results

The Postfunction will set the Tempo Account CF as per the object selected in the Insight Account CF
h3. Actual Results

The Insight Account Object is there, but the Tempo Account is not showing.
The Log shows:
{noformat}
2021-04-14 15:56:31,524-0400 http-nio-8080-exec-19 WARN 1007 956x1460x1 1123l2a 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/servicedesk/1/customer/requests/transition [c.r.j.p.insight_tempo_accounts.workflow.WorkflowFunction] Post function could not execute: PermissionInsightException: User JIRAUSER10702 didn't have correct permission (view) for object: 611,830
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Possibly use the Groovy Script postfunction to set the account on the Ticket.

Set the account on an Agent's transition.

Note:

Even if this is by design - the error suggests that the user (customer) does not have permission to view the Object. However - in the same transition, you may configure an Insight PF to Update an Object's Attribute with a predefined value or even to Create an object...even though the Customer does not have the permissions!

When you set up the application link between Confluence and Jira Service Management, and use this application link for the Insight Macros app in Confluence if the base URL of Jira doesn't match the application link URL, the icons of the table breaks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The macros work as expected, but the icon breaks. The app tries to append both URLs in Jira's side, which uses the 'jira-proxy' tool of the plugin.

Any differences between the base URL and the application link base URLs are appended, for example below:

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-14 at 13.03.43.png|thumbnail!

<stack-trace>java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Refusing to sign non-normalized URL: http://jiraservicedesk:8831/j831http://localhost:8831/j831/rest/insight/1.0/objecttype/2/icon.png?size=48 at
{code}
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-14 at 13.07.11.png|thumbnail!

Currently Insight JSON importer only supports basic authentication. As enterprise applications moving away from basic auth it's becoming a compatibility issue between Jira (Insight) and external sources

Introduce Token based authentication for JSON import

fields.description:
One customer is facing an issue where the share issue function is not working properly in JSD requests on Ubuntu+Frifox where the resolution is set to 1024x768 (4:3) or smaller.

The "share" function does open but entering any letter does not display the suggested co-workers.

The function works with Windows+Any Browser and under MacOS+Any Browser but it does not work with Ubuntu+Mozilla.

Based on our supported platforms, we support a minimum screen resolution of 1024 x 768 (when browsers are maximized).
----
Checking further, it turned out that the browser has a one-pixel border from the window manager by default, so the X11 window is actually only 1022 pixels wide when bringing the browser window to maximum size.

Unfortunately, we were not able to reproduce but the customer was able to test allowing for a small margin from window decorations for maximized browsers (some window managers have window borders that are more than a pixel, IceWM for example uses 6 pixels on each side) and this issue was resolved for them:
{quote}I’ve edited (in the browser debugging console) {{@media screen and (max-width:1023px)}} and changed it to {{@media screen and (max-width:1011px)}} and it worked.
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow for a small margin for window borders from window decorations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight Import Threshold Ignored
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the configuration for a schema and create an import configuration.
 # Create a new Object Type Mapping and set:
 ** The Threshold to Synchronisations, with a value of 10-20 something
 ** Set Missing Objects to "Update" and input any arbitrary value
 # Create an object manually that will not be imported.
 # Run a couple of synchronisations (not enough to trigger the threshold you set above) and look at "AO_8542F1_IFJ_IMPORT_MISS" in the database, the times_missed column should go up.
 # Change threshold to days, with a value that is lower than some object in the table "AO_8542F1_IFJ_IMPORT_MISS".
 # Try running the synchronisation again

h3. Expected Results

The object should not have the "Missing objects" related attribute updated, since we've just created the object.
h3. Actual Results

 
The synchronization thinks it has passed the threshold and will update the attribute value.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight Import Threshold Ignored

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation Rule does not trigger on Bulk Delete of Objects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an automation Rule to Create a Jira Issue when an Object is Deleted
 # create many objects, then try to delete them using Bulk Actions>Delete

h3. Expected Results

Objects are deleted, multiple Jira issues will be created - one per deleted object
h3. Actual Results

No Issus are created
h3. Workaround

Filter your objects in Insight>Search for Objects, then bulk delete them here. The automation will create a Jira Issue for each deleted object

 

*Additionally:*
 * Deleting an individual object using the object gear>Delete - Will create an Issue
 * Deleting One Issue (either Filtered, or its the only one in the object Type) using the Bulc Actions>Delete - No issue is created
 * Deleting Multiple Objects by deleting the whole Object Type - No Issue is created
fields.summary: Automation Rule does not trigger on Bulk Delete of Objects.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight automations with recursion has unpredictable behaviour
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation triggered by object update
 # Include a groovy script that will update an object that can trigger the automation itself
 # Manually update an update so that the automation is run
 # Look at the Jira log to monitor how the automation behaves

h3. Expected Results

This is a design choice, but at least it should be consistent. Do we allow it to keep calling itself or should a fail-safe be built in?
Furthermore, if attribute an attribute is updated on the object, the next script-call should use that updated value and not the old one.
h3. Actual Results

In the words of the user:
{quote}1. If a Groovy script is fired due to the update of, say,  object XY-123 and that script then makes 4 updates to attributes on XY-123, it is unpredictable how many times the script will be called again.  It can be anything from zero times to four times.

2. Related to the prior issue, if the script is called again, the object passed to the script does NOT reflect all updates.  For example, if the script is called again twice I often see this strange outcome: Call #1 – the script is passed an object with only 3 of the 4 changes included; Call #2 – the script is passed an object with only 2 of the 4 changes included.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight automations with recursion has unpredictable behaviour

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hide an Insight CF in a JSD Portal fails validation of "Automatic" as a default value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set an Insight CF with a Filter Assign Scope
 # Add the Insight CF to a Request in Jira Service Desk - enable and show it.
 # Try to hide the CF - a screen will request to set a Default Value for the CF showing "Automatic" as the current default > Click SET to save it

h3. Expected Results

The Window closes and the Hidden Insight CF is populated according to the Filter Assign Scope.
h3. Actual Results

You get a Validation Error from the CF:
!image-2020-11-04-18-07-48-245.png|width=291,height=124!
h3. Workaround

Delete the Automatic "Value" using backspace, and click SET to close the screen.

The Automatic "Value" will remain (click "Edit Value" - to review it) - and the Hidden CF will be populated correctly when a Ticket is created.
fields.summary: Hide an Insight CF in a JSD Portal fails validation of "Automatic" as a default value.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performance - loading a lot of objects with avatars causes the macro to make too many requests
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The way I was able to reproduce this bug was by doing the following :
 # Setup an LDAP with 3000 Users, connect it to Jira

 # set for some/all of these users avatars
 # Setup a Jira user import in Insight
 # Connect the macro to user import schema
 # Look at the network tab for the images tab requests

h3. Expected Results

The macro should request one avatar per object
h3. Actual Results

The macro actually doubles that number for the number of requests which overloads the server when viewing many objects per macro (500)

Started in 1.6.0 

Also: In the Macro Configuration, when accessing a Schema with a lot of Object Types and Attributes - the Attribute Picker can take up to 15-20  minutes to load available Attributes. and very slow to respond when selecting Attributes.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Performance - loading a lot of objects with avatars causes the macro to make too many requests

fields.description:
First some background on why do want to have certain projects be invisible in the main portal. 

I am trying to find a  good solution to make the Vote option useful. At the moment it seems that a user is only able to vote on their own requests or the request being shared with him by organization. 

We already using the Organization solution to make it easy to automatically share requests between people within the same organization.  Adding an additional Organization in the same project will lose the functionality to automatically open issues for Organizations. 

The solution I was thinking of is to:
 # Create a new Service Management project for all issues we want to collect votes for
 # Add one Organization (e.g. Feedback) and add all customers (would also be nice to make it possible to add people automatically to this Organization)
 # No issues to create

As there are no issues to create and no knowledge base attached ( I wouldn't know what to put in there) there is no use to have a visible portal as that will be an empty box. So it would be really nice to make it possible to make the tile for this project invisible.

Customers will be able to access the requests to vote on through the request button by selecting shared by Organization "Feedback".

 (I was requested to make this suggestion: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management/Remove-project-tile-from-main-portal/qaq-p/1626608?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=solution_to_question&utm_content=topic)
fields.summary: Remove project tile from main portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we call the {{/rest/servicedeskapi//request//\{issueKey\}//approval}} endpoint, it brings us the approvers _currently_ in the approvers custom field, even if it was edited at some point.
 
 The UI, on the other hand, brings the correct information.
 h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow with an approval step
# Have "User A" approve it
# Change the approver custom field to "User B"
# Call the \{{/rest/servicedeskapi/request/\{issueKey\}/approval}} endpoint

h3. Expected Results

The approver was "User A", so that user should be returned in the API call.
h3. Actual Results

Along with the approval details, it states that "User B" has approved the request
h3. Workaround

Query the data directly from the database. For PostgreSQL, it would be something like this for the issue with the key SD-42:
{code:sql}
SELECT *
FROM jiraissue i
JOIN project p on i.project=p.id
JOIN "AO_56464C_APPROVAL" a on a."ISSUE_ID"=i.ID
JOIN "AO_56464C_APPROVERDECISION" ad on ad."APPROVAL_ID"=a."ID"
JOIN app_user u on ad."USER_KEY"=u.user_key
WHERE i.issuenum='42'
AND p.pkey='SD'
{code}
fields.summary: REST API approval endpoint return the current Approvers, not the actual approvers
